channel.title: I'd Just like to say
channel.description: I love kubuntu, I just downloaded it. Its amazing. Thanks ron for the tut on dual booting :)

item.title: I'd Just like to say
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:148795”][quote author=nicatron link=topic=203713.msg1796952#msg1796952 date=1191393176]
PClinuxOS < *Ubuntu
*Ubuntu is EXTREAMLY better that PC linux. It has a choice of KDE, GNOME and XFCE. PC linux has only KDE (Which sucks). Also a new version is coming out very soon!
[/quote]
you’re an idiot, you can run any wm on any distro, on pclos you just apt-get install xfce, and its ready.[/quote]
Lawl is correct once again.

Read full topic

item.title: I'd Just like to say
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

Not X A Alex:

Like I said, Do I need to download somthing?

Just fucking type
sudo apt-get install pidgin
in the fucking terminal.

Read full topic

item.title: I'd Just like to say
item.dc:creator: @Not_X_A_Alex Not X A Alex
item.description:
@Not_X_A_Alex wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:13, topic:148550”][quote author=Not X A Alex link=topic=203713.msg1797752#msg1797752 date=1191447788]

Anything new is going to have a slight learning curve, but you will get used to it shortly.

Yeah, I can’t download aim on it cause I don’t really get installing things…
[/quote]

Open Konsole and type ‘sudo apt-get install pidgin’. There, you got MSN/AIM/Jabber/ICQ/Yaho/etc :P[/quote]
Do I need to download anything?

Read full topic

item.title: I'd Just like to say
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

That, and KDE is faster. Fact.[br][size=1]Posted on: October 03, 2007, 02:00:21 PM[/size][hr][quote=“Rictoo, post:13, topic:148550”][quote author=Not X A Alex link=topic=203713.msg1797752#msg1797752 date=1191447788]

Anything new is going to have a slight learning curve, but you will get used to it shortly.

Yeah, I can’t download aim on it cause I don’t really get installing things…
[/quote]

Open Konsole and type ‘sudo apt-get install pidgin’. There, you got MSN/AIM/Jabber/ICQ/Yaho/etc :P[/quote]
Yea, pidgin for the win.

Read full topic

item.title: I'd Just like to say
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Silver Lining:

[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=203713.msg1797094#msg1797094 date=1191397024]KDE is the best.[/quote]That’s just your opinion. You should prefix it with a “imo” so people don’t take it as fact. The only related sentence one could say that should be taken as fact is “fluxbox is the best.”

You didn’t quote the whole thing, I said ‘I would disagree, KDE is best’, which implied that it was my opinion. If someone wants to take it as fact it doesn’t bother me any.

Read full topic

item.title: I'd Just like to say
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

Silver Lining:

[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=203713.msg1797094#msg1797094 date=1191397024]KDE is the best.[/quote]That’s just your opinion. You should prefix it with a “imo” so people don’t take it as fact. The only related sentence one could say that should be taken as fact is “fluxbox is the best.”

Hahaha, both KDE and fluxbox (and openbox) are very nice. This is like comparing apples to oranges (oranges ftw!).

Read full topic

item.title: I'd Just like to say
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I would disagree on that, KDE is the best.

However PClinuxOS uses it’s own package system (rpm packages with APT, strange huh?) which are not compatible with other distrobutions (like ubuntu is compatible with debian packages), and the one other thing I don’t like about PCLOS is they do not provide amd64 builds

Read full topic
